Question_Text: What types of plagiarism detection capabilities would you consider?
Answer_A: Database matching against academic sources and web content only
Answer_B: AI-generated content detection plus traditional source matching
Answer_C: Writing style analysis and paraphrasing detection capabilities
Answer_D: Comprehensive behavioral analysis including submission patterns and editing history

Question_Text: How would plagiarism detections be integrated in your educational setting?
Answer_A: Optional tool for instructors to use at their discretion
Answer_B: Required screening for specific high-stakes assignments only
Answer_C: Systematic screening of all written work with instructor review
Answer_D: Automated screening with direct integration into grading workflows

Question_Text: What type of appeals process would you consider having?
Answer_B: Students can request instructor reconsideration with additional evidence
Answer_C: Department-level or administrator review of AI flagging

Question_Text: What type of training would faculty receive on interpreting AI integrity results?
Answer_A: Faculty rely on vendor documentation and personal judgment
Answer_B: Brief orientation session on using the software
Answer_C: Comprehensive training on AI limitations bias risks and evidence evaluation
Answer_D: Ongoing professional development with case studies and bias awareness updates

Question_Text: What type of student-AI interaction would you consider?
Answer_A: Simple Q&A interface with no conversational elements
Answer_B: Basic chat interface with neutral informational responses
Answer_C: Conversational AI with friendly encouraging tone and personalized responses
Answer_D: Anthropomorphic tutor with human-like personality emotions and relationship-building

Question_Text: How would LLM tutors be integrated into your curriculum?
Answer_A: Supplemental resource that students can access voluntarily
Answer_B: Assigned tool for specific subjects or struggling students only
Answer_C: Standard support integrated across multiple courses and assignments
Answer_D: Primary instructional delivery method replacing some traditional teaching

Question_Text: What level of student data collection would you allow?
Answer_A: No persistent data - each session independent
Answer_B: Basic analytics - session frequency and duration without conversation content
Answer_C: Detailed learning analytics - conversation logs and progress tracking across sessions
Answer_D: Comprehensive behavioral profiling - personality traits and learning patterns for interventions

Question_Text: What oversight approach would you implement for AI tutor interactions?
Answer_A: Student-directed use with teachers maintaining focus on direct instruction
Answer_B: Periodic teacher review adding light monitoring duties to existing responsibilities
Answer_C: Regular teacher evaluation of AI interactions requiring dedicated review time
Answer_D: Comprehensive teacher oversight requiring continuous monitoring and quality assurance work
